title: Welcome to [NAME PENDING]!
content: In this game, you command a private ship. There is treasure to be found and you can find it. Scan the area and loot your treasure. Send your gold on ship upgrades and Special actions. Fight your enemies and be wary of pirates. Dying could me losing a lot more than just your loot!

subSections.title: Controls
subSections.content:
ActionButton
AttackLeft Click
MoveWASD or ←↑→↓
Scan1
Loot2
Hold3
Special Action 1Q
Special Action 2E
Place WallR
SettingsESC
MapM
Join Team Window8 or J
Player List Window9 or P
Team Window0 or T
Close WindowESC
ChatENTER
Toggle Chat ModeCTRL
Open Shopo
Stats ToggleI
Remove ActionClick the action

subSections.title: Interface
subSections.content:
This is the screen that you see when you start the game. Enter a name to begin.

This is the main view screen. You are always in the center of the screen. Everything operates on a grid in semi-realtime. The top bar is the round counter, and this tells you how long you have left in a round to put in your actions. The action queue are the actions that will happen this round. If you scan the area, loot will appear. Grab loot to get gold. The battle log is where all messages and chat is shown.

subSections.title: Rounds
subSections.content: The game operates on a global round counter. Every player has three action points to spend each round and three seconds to select them. Once the time is up, all actions will occur in the queue order. Empty queue slots are filled with 'Hold' actions.

subSections.title: Death
subSections.content: When you die, if you do not have insurance, you will drop all of your loot. In addition to this, all of your skills and items will decrease by a single level. You can respawn after 3 rounds by clicking one of the glowing respawn options. If you capture one of the special bases, you can respawn near that base.

subSections.title: Basic Actions
subSections.content: These actions are the base actions that every player is equipped with. No matter what modifications are added or how many deaths a player has, they will always be able to do these basic actions.

subSections.title: Attack
subSections.content:
Attacking is the standard way of dealing damage in this game. Simply click on the screen where you would like to attack to deal damage in that location. Careful: you can damage yourself if you move into the spot that you attacked. Go to the Basic Shop to purchase attack upgrades.

LevelAction SlotsEnergy CostUranium CostDamage
11101
21102
31103
41104

subSections.title: Hold
subSections.content: When you don't want to act or you don't input any actions, a hold action takes place. This action represents your ship staying put for a moment. When you hold, you recover some energy. Use this action wisely.

subSections.title: Loot
subSections.content: When you have discovered loot, this how you retrieve it. Looting makes you stationary for just a moment as it takes 2 actions and 3 energy to loot something. Make sure the area is clear before you try for some treasure.

subSections.title: Move
subSections.content: This action is how you travel. You can move North, South, East or West. Moving takes only one action spot, so you can move up to 3 spots per turn.

subSections.title: Place Wall
subSections.content: Placing walls is essential for defending bases. Walls can be placed on any base tile that is owned by the team the player is on (and if the team leader allows the player to). To place a wall, press 'r' and click where you want to place it. Walls do need to be placed directly beside the player and it takes one action slot to place a wall. Note you will need a wall license and walls to actually place the wall. Don't worry though, walls don't drop on death.

subSections.title: Scan
subSections.content:
Scanning is both how you find loot and keep track of your enemies. Scanning takes 5 energy and an entire round to complete. Once done, all treasure in your radar length will be revealed along with all enemies for a set number of turns. Higher levels of the scanner will maintain enemies on screen longer and differentiate loot as well. You can upgrade your scanner at a level 2+ base.

LevelAction SlotsEnergy CostUranium CostLoot RevealedEnemies Revealed
1350Gold3 Rounds
2350Iron4 Rounds
3350Uranium5 Rounds

subSections.title: Special Actions
subSections.content: Special Actions are actions acquired by modifying your ship. To acquire a Special action, you simply purchase it from a level 2+ base. Every action works differently and most all of them require uranium to activate. So use them wisely.

subSections.title: Blink
subSections.content:
Blink is purchasable from level 2+ bases. To use, simply equip it to a mod slot and activate it. Once active, click on the screen where you would like to transport to. Upgrading the Blink Module will decrease the overall cost of using it.

LevelAction SlotsEnergy CostUranium Cost
11101
2181
3161

subSections.title: Cannon
subSections.content:
The cannon is purchasable from level 2+ bases. To use, simply equip it to a mod slot and activate it. Once active, click on the screen where you would like to attack. All highlighted tiles will be effected by your damage. This is the idea weapon for hurting multiple targets or ensuring your target does not escape.

LevelAction SlotsEnergy CostUranium CostDamage MultiplierArea of Effect
121011x3x3
221011x5x5
321011.5x5x5

subSections.title: Destealth
subSections.content: The destealth action is a required action to take after attempting to perform an action that can not be performed while stealthed. To manually destealh, just activate stealth while stealthed to add a destealth action to the queue. Or perform another action to add it automatically.

subSections.title: Energy Module
subSections.content:
The energy module is purchasable from level 2+ bases. To use, simply equip it to a mod slot and activate it. You will recover energy after a single action. Note this requires uranium to active so be sure to have a stockpile around. Upgrading the Energy Module will increase the amount of energy recovered.

LevelAction SlotsUranium CostEnergy Recovered
1115
21110
31115

subSections.title: Quick Heal
subSections.content: The quick heal is purchasable from level 2+ bases. To use, simply equip it to a mod slot and activate it. You will recover all health after a single action. This will consume the quick heal, so use it wisely.

subSections.title: Railgun
subSections.content:
The railgun is purchasable from level 2+ bases. To use, simply equip it to a mod slot and activate it. Once active, click on the screen where you would like to attack. This weapon attacks in a straight line from your current location. All highlighted tiles will be effected by your damage. This is the idea weapon for destroying single (and sometimes multiple) targets.

LevelAction SlotsEnergy CostUranium CostDamage MultiplierRange
121012x10
221013x10
321014x10

subSections.title: Stealth
subSections.content:
The stealth module is purchasable from level 2+ bases. To use, simply equip it to a mod slot and activate it. It will take an entire round to stealth, but once stealthed you will be removed from enemy scanners and be invisible to all enemies. They will need to scan again to find you. While stealthed you can move and scan freely. Any other action will require you to destealth first. After a set duration, you will automatically lose stealth. Upgrading your stealth increases this duration.

LevelAction SlotsEnergy CostUranium CostDuration
13513 rounds
23516 rounds
33519 rounds

subSections.title: Trap
subSections.content:
The trap is purchasable from level 2+ bases. To use, simply equip it to a mod slot and activate it. You will place a trap where you are located. You and your teammates are immune to your own traps, but not to enemy traps. Once an enemy enters a tile where a trap is located, it will activate and the player will be unable to move or blink for 3 rounds. You will also get a notification of which of your traps went off. So use this to your advantage. Upgrading your traps will increase the size and remove the uranium cost.

LevelAction SlotsEnergy CostUranium CostTrap SizeRounds Affected
12812x23
22813x33
32803x33

subSections.title: Editing Loadout
subSections.content: To edit your ship, you can go to a base of level 2+, and click the [Lo]adout tab. In this tab you can equip and unequip your items to modify your ship for whatever task you are trying to complete.

title: Teams
content:
Teams are the basis of this game. Teams come in all shapes and sizes and can be managed however the leader sees fit. Any player can create a new team and most players can join any team. With a team, you can capture bases to bring in income and to seize power. All team data is tracked and can be seen on the homepage leaderboard. When on a team, you can always see where your teammates are located. You can also chat privately with team chat and you will ignore ally traps. Allies will appear on your radar as 'hudColor' players rather than enemy colors. Your attacks will still deal damage to allies, so be careful where you attack.

Red Team, Yellow Team, Blue Team, and Green Team are default teams that always exist with no leadership.

subSections.title: Joining Teams
subSections.content:
At the start of the game, you are asked to join a team. There are two primary ways to join a team: You can access the Join Team Window and select a team that has an 'open' invite policy



or you can accept an invite from a friend to join their team (message will appear on sidebar).


You must be on a team to play. If you want to play independently, you can create and run your own one person team.

To officially join a team, you must have a join token available. You start with 2 join tokens and these tokens increase about every 1 hour of gameplay. Join teams wisely. If you ever get stuck on a team you don't like, you can always create your own team.

subSections.title: Creating Teams
subSections.content:
To create a team, go to the Join Team Window and click '+ Create Team'. The create team window will open and you will be able to decide a name (max 20 characters), choose a base shape, choose a base color and area color. Team names must be unique, and colors must be different enough from another base. So you can't make an exact copy of another team.


After you create your team, the team settings view will open so you can adjust your teams settings. To learn more about these settings look at Settings View.

subSections.title: Summary View
subSections.content: The summary page is the main view for the Team Window. This view provides you with stats about the team relating to control, rank, and income. From this view, you can look at bases controlled and not controlled by the team. To view bases, hover over the map to gather info. If you are able to ping the map, you can click a base to set the objective for the team. If you select a base that you own, you can upgrade it from this place (provided the settings allow you). Use this view to decide what to capture and what to defend as a team.

subSections.title: Member View
subSections.content: The member view displays all members on the team. Online members are displayed in 'hudColor' while offline members are grayed out. From this view, admins can remove members by clicking the members they wish to kick and removing them. The leader of the team can promote or demote members to Admin or Leader status. There can only ever exist one leader.

subSections.title: The Vault
subSections.content: Teams bring in income when they control bases. The more bases controlled, the faster the income is brought in. The vault view can display how much loot the team has independent of its members.

subSections.title: Settings View
subSections.content:
The settings view is where team settings can be adjusted. Note that only the leader of the team can make adjustments.

SettingDescriptionOptions
MembershipThis setting adjusts how new members can join the team.
  • OPEN -> Anyone can join. Visible in Join Team Window
  • INVITE -> Any member can invite new members
  • AD INV -> Only admins can invite new members
Can PingThis setting adjusts who is allowed to set objectives on the summary page.
  • TEAM -> All members can ping the map
  • ADMIN-> Only admins can ping the map
  • LEADER -> Only the leader can ping the map
Can BuildThis setting adjusts who can build walls in base territory.
  • TEAM -> All members can build walls
  • ADMIN-> Only admins can build walls
  • LEADER -> Only the leader can build walls
Can UpgradeThis setting adjust who is allowed to initiate base upgrades.
  • ADMIN-> Only admins can ping the map
  • LEADER -> Only the leader can ping the map
Profit SplitThis setting adjusts how the profit is split amongst the team.
  • FAIR-> All profits are split equally among all members
  • AD 50%-> 50% of profit is split between admins and members
  • AD ONLY -> Only admins receive profits
  • LD 50%-> 50% of profit is split between leader and members
  • LEADER-> Only the leader receive profits
TaxThis setting adjust how much gold is taken from the shared profit for each member.Options are the percentage take from team members that receive profit.

subSections.title: Inviting New Members
subSections.content: To invite new members, open the Player list and click on the player you want to invite to your team.

subSections.title: Merging and Spliting
subSections.content: If you are the leader of a team with multiple members, and you decide to join another team, you are given the option to SPLIT from your team or to MERGE your team into the new one. When you split from your team, a new leader will be selected and the team will continue onward without you. When you merge your team, all loot, bases, and members will be added to the new team. This can be useful if you want to join forces with another team to take down a greater foe. If you are a team of one, your team will auto-merge with the new team. NOTE: When merging or splitting you will join the new team as a standard member. Make sure you are prepared for whatever changes come with that decision as merging a team is permanent.

title: Bases
content: Bases are the fuel of teams. Capturing and holding bases will yield passive income for the entire team every 5 rounds. In addition to that, some bases may have special gains like uranium, iron, or even act as a spawn point for the team. Players can defend their bases by building walls and upgrading them to be more robust. Bases will defend themselves, but usually require a little bit of assistance when been assaulted.

subSections.title: Types of Bases
subSections.content:
There are three main levels of bases (and one special level). No matter the base shape, all bases are treated the same and follow the same patterns:
LevelHPDamageAttacks Per RoundRecommended Players
120111
250222 - 3
3100333 - 5
4 (Special)1000044025 - 100

Level 1 and level 2 bases spawn throughout the map, with level 2 appearing more frequently closer to the hot zone and level 1 appearing near the spawn. Level 3 bases are only unlocked by upgrading and the special base is the base in the middle of spawn.

subSections.title: Capturing Bases
subSections.content:
To capture a base, simply attack it. Bases that a neutral will not attack until provoked where enemy team bases will attack visible enemies within its territory automatically. When base comes under fire, the team that owns it will be alerted and may come to defend. In addition to this, the base itself will attack as well. So assault bases wisely.

Once a base has been captured, it will need a few rounds before its systems are back online. It will restart at half health and only be able to attack again when full health is reached. During this time, you may need to still defend the base as it is more vulnerable than normal. If a base is captured while its upgrading, the upgrade will be cancelled and the resources will be lost. So defend your bases.

subSections.title: Upgrading Bases
subSections.content:
There are many reasons to upgrade your bases. Higher level bases generate more revenue, are harder to capture, and increase the team's power score. Generally, it's only a benefit to upgrade your bases. To upgrade a base, click the base you want to upgrade on the Team Summary Window and click the upgrade button.


Upgrading a base has an associated cost (as listed below). This cost comes from the team's vault. The only way currently to obtain money to pay for the costs is to capture bases. Note that unless there is a tax, the team vault will not generate gold revenue.
Level TransitionCost
1 -> 2
  • Gold: 5000
  • Credits: 10000
  • Iron: 80
  • Uranium: 10
2 -> 3
  • Gold: 10000
  • Credits: 20000
  • Iron: 160
  • Uranium: 30
3 -> 4
  • Gold: 9999999
  • Credits: 9999999
  • Iron: 99999
  • Uranium: 9999


Once a base upgrade has been initiated, the base will begin working on it. During this time, the base can not defend itself and will be completely vulnerable to enemy attacks. Make sure your team is ready ahead of time to defend the base. If the base is captured while upgrading, your team will not be refunded the spent resources.

subSections.title: Gains
subSections.content:
By owning a base, your team will passively gain income based on the outputs from the base. You won't know a bases specific outputs unless you own the base, but you can see what kind of outputs are expected by looking at the different bases in Team Summary Window.


Generally speaking, Gold output > Silver Output > Bronze Output. Bases also might have a special output like iron or uranium.

When you upgrade a base, the overall output will also increase. The output is calculated by the level multiplied by the base output. So level 2 bases produce twice as much as a level 1 base.

subSections.title: Shops
subSections.content: Shops are where you can purchase upgrades, repair your ship, and modify your ship. Any base that is either neutral or owned by your team acts as a shop. Different base levels change the inventory of the shop with level 3+ bases selling all inventory. When near a shop you can press 'o' to open the shop menu. Note that bases need to be out of combat to work as a shop.
